page.title: 04Large Houses and Manors
page.content: There are 4 manor houses around the village of Shorwell. The oldest, Kingston Manor, is an original 13th century stone building, remodelled in the 17th century. The present family, the Mews, have lived in the house for the last 350 years. 2 of the other manor houses, West Court and Wolverton, were built of local stone in the 16th century. The remaining manor house, by far the largest, North Court, was built in the early 17th century. The only 2 other substantial buildings are Limerstone farmhouse and Yafford Mill.
